summary: This is an email exchange from August 13-14, 2019, between U.S. Attorney Geoffrey Berman and another prosecutor regarding the investigation of Jeffrey Epstein. Berman requests a summary of forfeiture options for Epstein's properties in New York, Florida, and the Virgin Islands, and discusses evidence needed to pursue those residences.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein

connections.description: Berman, as U.S. Attorney, is directing the investigation and potential forfeiture actions against Epstein and his properties.

events.title: Forfeiture options summary requested
events.description: U.S. Attorney Geoffrey Berman requests a summary of forfeiture options regarding Jeffrey Epstein's properties to be ready by Thursday morning.

keyFacts: U.S. Attorney Geoffrey Berman was actively pursuing forfeiture of Jeffrey Epstein's properties in New York, Florida, and the Virgin Islands in August 2019.
The email exchange shows coordination within the prosecution team regarding evidence needed to support forfeiture actions.
The timing (August 2019) places this communication shortly after Epstein's arrest in July 2019 and before his death in August 2019.
The document reveals the prosecution's strategy to target Epstein's assets across multiple jurisdictions.
